senses.de: To support or persuade someone to do something
senses.ex: My parents always encouraged me to pursue my dreams.

Tips.title: Positive Reinforcement
Tips.description: Using 'encourage' suggests giving someone confidence to continue doing something good.
Tips.example: Teachers encourage students when they praise their hard work.

Tips.title: Subtle Persuasion
Tips.description: 'Encourage' often means gently pushing someone towards a decision without pressure.
Tips.example: My coach encouraged me to join the competition.

Tips.title: Emotional Support
Tips.description: The word can imply emotional backing for personal matters.
Tips.example: His kind words encouraged me during tough times.

senses.de: To make something more likely to happen

Tips.title: Likelihood Increase
Tips.description: 'Encourage' can mean to help increase the odds that something will happen.
Tips.example: Programs that encourage recycling have become widespread.

Tips.title: Growth Enhancement
Tips.description: Often used in a context where 'encourage' aims to advance development or progress.
Tips.example: The new policy encourages small business growth.

senses.de: To cheer or inspire in hopes of boosting confidence or morale
senses.ex: He encouraged his team in the middle of the game to keep going.

Tips.title: Boosting Morale
Tips.description: It can refer to acts that uplift someone's spirit or drive.
Tips.example: Fans encouraged the players with their cheers.

Tips.title: Confidence Building
Tips.description: 'Encourage' might be used about instilling confidence in someone's own abilities.
Tips.example: Her mentor's feedback encouraged her to take on more challenges.

senses.de: To advise or urge (someone) to do something
senses.ex: She encouraged me to apply for the job.

Tips.title: Soft Guidance
Tips.description: Using 'encourage' can be a gentle way to guide someone’s actions or decisions.
Tips.example: The seminar encouraged them to think creatively.

Tips.title: Endorsement
Tips.description: 'Encourage' can signify endorsing or supporting a particular course of action.
Tips.example: Experts encourage wearing masks in crowded areas.

Tips.title: Action Motivation
Tips.description: Can express motivating someone to act, especially when they're hesitant.
Tips.example: She encouraged her friend to speak up about the issue.

Boost.wordDefinition: Boost means to increase or improve something, such as confidence or energy. It is applicable in situations where someone needs a direct push or motivation.

Embolden.wordDefinition:
Embolden means to give someone the courage or confidence to do something daring or risky.

Embolden is used to inspire someone to take action, while encourage is used to provide emotional support or motivation to continue doing something.

Foster.wordDefinition:
Foster means to nurture, develop or promote something. For example, a family can foster a child who needs a home by providing a safe and loving environment for them to grow.

Encourage is used to give emotional support and motivation, while foster is used in a more practical sense to develop or promote something.

Incite.wordDefinition:
The difference between the words encourage and incite is that encourage means to support, push someone to do something good, or to make them feel confident, while incite means to provoke, urge someone to do something wrong or something that leads to harm.

If a person incites a group of people to take violent action or cause harm to someone, it means that person is trying to provoke them to do something wrong.

Encourage is a positive word and is used to motivate and inspire people to do good things, while incite is a negative word and often used in situations where someone is trying to provoke or urge others to do something harmful or dangerous.

Inspire.wordDefinition:
Inspire means to stimulate or motivate someone to do something creative, great or extraordinary. It involves an emotional or intellectual push to make someone feel excited, hopeful, and eager to achieve a goal.

For example, a musician's performance may inspire an aspiring artist to pursue their passion.

Motivate.wordDefinition:
Motivation means giving someone a reason to do something.

It is usually used to inspire someone to take action or achieve something. For example, if someone wants to get better grades, you might motivate them by offering them a reward when they achieve their goal.

In summary, encouragement is used to help someone feel good, while motivation is used to inspire someone to take action.

Promote.wordDefinition:
Promote means to help something grow or become more popular. For example, if you are trying to start a small business, you can promote it by advertising and spreading the word to potential customers.

Encourage is used to give someone a boost or motivation, while promote is used to increase awareness or popularity of something.

Spur.wordDefinition:
Encourage means to give someone support and confidence to do something, while the word spur means to motivate or inspire someone to take action or move forward.

If your friend is feeling unmotivated to start studying, you can spur them by reminding them of the benefits of a good grade, or challenging them to start with just a small amount of studying and build from there.

Encourage focuses on building confidence and positivity, while spur focuses on motivating action and progress.

Stimulate.wordDefinition:
Stimulate means to activate, excite or encourage a response or reaction, like drinking coffee to stimulate alertness.

Encourage is used when referring to motivating and supporting people, while stimulate is used when referring to a physical or mental reaction or enhancement.

Urge.wordDefinition:
Urge means to strongly suggest or persuade someone to do something.

For example, "I urged my friend to go to the doctor because their cough sounded really bad."

So, while both ‘encourage’ and ‘urge’ have the same goal to motivate someone to do something, ‘encourage’ focuses on more emotional support, while ‘urge’ is more intent on pushing someone to make immediate decisions or take specific action.

quotes.Text: Are we a nation that educates the world's best and brightest in our universities, only to send them home to create businesses in countries that compete against us? Or are we a nation that encourages them to stay and create jobs, businesses, and industries right here in America?
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: If you look at the history of our country over the last 100 years, there have been periods where science and research have been celebrated. They were really kind of held up as heroes in society, which encouraged a generation of people to go into these fields.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: It took me 40 years to write my first book. When I was a child, I was encouraged to go to school. I was not encouraged to follow the career of a writer because my parents thought that I was going to starve to death.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Novelist
quotes.Name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.Text: If you are a leader, you should never forget that everyone needs encouragement. And everyone who receives it - young or old, successful or less-than-successful, unknown or famous - is changed by it.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: John C. Maxwell

quotes.Text: When you encourage others, you in the process are encouraged because you're making a commitment and difference in that person's life. Encouragement really does make a difference.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.Text: Things in themselves have no life in them. A car can't comfort or encourage you. A house means nothing if there's no life and love inside.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: I've always been very happy. I've always been easy going and I've always been very encouraging; it's just my personality.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: Anything that encourages people to pick up an instrument and play, I'm fully behind.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Taylor Swift

quotes.Text: Encourage your children to read more and watch television less.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.Text: He who does not prevent a crime when he can, encourages it.
quotes.Title: Roman Statesman
quotes.Name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
